By the way you can follow the ancestry of any image back to its first 
ance=
stor (i.e. the first image that someone evolved from scratch that 
is a lin=
k in the chain of branches to the image) from the detailed 
view by pressin=
g on the parent.  For example, here is the detail for 
the car:

http://pic=
breeder.org/search/showgenome.php?sid=3D464

If you follow the car all the =
way back, you will eventually find that 
its distant ancestor is this "clow=
n face":

http://picbreeder.org/search/showgenome.php?sid=3D57

ken

Interactive
> > Evolution Exp=
eriment
> > 
> > Hi Everyone, 
> > 
> > I am pleased to announce the openin=
g of Picbreeder, a massive
> > experiment in collaborative interactive evol=
ution, which happens 
to
> > be based on NEAT:
> > 
> > http://picbreeder.o=
rg
> > 
> > Picbreeder is a unique online service that allows users with no=

> > artistic experience to evolve pictures in collaboration with each
> > =
other. The technology behind Picbreeder is a novel NEAT-based 
Genetic
> > =
Art applet that is integrated into a massive growing "tree of 
life"
> > th=
at never ends. Anyone who evolves a picture they like can 
publish
> > it t=
o the world and thereby permanently add their creations to the
> > ever-exp=
anding tree of life.
> > 
> > What makes Picbreeder particularly powerful a=
nd unique is that you
> > can *branch* from the published work of any other=
 user that has 
come
> > before.  In other words, you do not have to begin =
from scratch.
> > Instead, for example, if you want to a evolve a face, you=
 can 
branch
> > from one of the many published faces and explore an infini=
te 
number
> > of variations from that starting point.
> > 
> > Perhaps mos=
t intriguing is that we do not know what is possible to
> > evolve.  As lin=
eages are built upon lineages, complexification in
> > NEAT means that imag=
es can theoretically become more and more
> > complex.  Thus, in theory, an=
ything is possible.  In this sense
> > Picbreeder's users are pioneers, exp=
loring collectively a space 
that
> > has never been exhaustively explored =
and discovering together
> > creations that no one of us could have discove=
red alone.
> > 
> > I hope that you will decide to join us on Picbreeder as=
 we explore
> > this space.
> > 
> > ken
> >
>
